accused.name: Petroniere femme Jean Varnier dit Bessat

confession.devil_appearance: large and black, in form like a human man
confession.seduction_date: about a year earlier (varied accounts: 'some time', '4 days earlier')
confession.seduction_context: in fields behind the chateau; devil promised she would always be with him and he would give her much; she received nothing
sabbat_activities: said she attended once, twice, many times - very inconsistent testimony; claimed all were disguised and she recognized no one

witnesses.name: Marie femme Mongeon Francois le jeune

testimony.quarrel_subject: her son aged 14-15 was chosen as cattle herdsman's assistant instead of one of Petroniere's sons
dispute with his wife Zabillon and her father Nicolas le Moine over some cloth damaged by a child

harms_alleged.target: Zabillon daughter of Nicolas le Moine (his wife)
harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: died five months after marriage, 18 months before testimony

witnesses.name: Jean Francois
witnesses.occupation: paistre du troupeau des bestes blanches (white cattle herdsman)

testimony.quarrel_subject: Petroniere asked him to take one of her sons as assistant and was angry when he chose another boy
testimony.threat_quote: she threatened him that he would repent

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: became eticq at Easter, then died

testimony.quarrel_subject: Petroniere warned her husband about damaging young tree when crossing her land with a cart; she touched horse
animals had eaten some of Petroniere's oats and she had been angry
mother-in-law contracted with Jean Varnier to harvest hay for part payment; husband cancelled arrangement and gave Varnier 3 gros; he and wife were furious

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: ill for 18 weeks after giving birth

witnesses.name: Mengeon Mainel
witnesses.occupation: jeune homme a marier (young unmarried man)

testimony.quarrel_subject: he stepped on Petroniere's goose with a horse and broke its leg; she demanded payment

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: night before his father was to cart manure for her husband

testimony.quarrel_subject: her children had been fighting with one of Petroniere's, and her husband had struck the latter
testimony.threat_quote: qu'il prenoit grande peine, mais qu'avant qu'il fust peu de temps le diable en emporteroit des pieces

witnesses.name: Nicolas Besdel
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor, lived in same house, had legal dispute

testimony.quarrel_subject: children's fight (same as witness 10); also had legal dispute (proces)

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after a dispute about a house

testimony.quarrel_subject: various quarrels
dispute as result of pig which escaped and did some damage
dispute with Petroniere's daughter Francoise, and great quarrels they had previously when they lived together
Petroniere served at fiancailles feast but behaved insolently from drinking too much; witness decided not to employ her at marriage feast, only invited to sit with other women - but she did not come

harms_alleged.target: fire in the house during marriage feast

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: fell ill during feast, died after languishing more than a year
after they refused to take Petroniere's daughter as servant
found dead in cot after Petroniere had been to see it

witnesses.name: Marie Grand Didier femme Nicolas Valot

testimony.quarrel_subject: refused to take Petroniere's daughter into service because she was too small, although Petroniere offered to come do hard tasks herself

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: day before death Petroniere picked baby up, felt its body, murmured 'qu'aultant valloit qu'il fust mort et qu'il estoit mort'

witnesses.name: Curien Daguet
witnesses.occupation: paistre des bestes rouges (red cattle herdsman)

testimony.quarrel_subject: she did not want to pay for keeping of her animals
cooking bread for several neighbors, had to wait for Petroniere; told her she should not be late au preiudice d'autruy
testimony.threat_quote: she would not be satisfied ains sembloit le menacer soubs paroles couvertes

testimony.quarrel_subject: he and his brother Thomas refused to let a house to Jean Varnier, crainte du mauvais gré des voisins

witnesses.name: George Hatton
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: lived in same house 14 years before

testimony.quarrel_subject: various quarrels, pour ce qu'elle estolt fort terrible et qu'elle l'incomodoit en plusieurs sortes

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: soon after he struck her with a buche

testimony.quarrel_subject: her husband caught Petroniere taking terrasse from their garden and reprimanded her

witnesses.name: Nicole femme Nicolas Gerardin
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor, later lived in same house

testimony.quarrel_subject: had made accord to share tenancy of house from Marc Varnier with Petroniere and husband, then rescinded it because not satisfied with terms

witnesses.name: Marie fille de feu Claude Masson

testimony.quarrel_subject: Petroniere reproached her that she had not helped her as she had done previously to transport her belongings from one house to another
quarrels when they lived in same house

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: previous year after she predicted it

testimony.quarrel_subject: quarrelled with her husband over aide generale
dispute over his payment for helping her and husband in woods

witnesses.name: David Viriot
witnesses.occupation: musnier de S.A. au village de Laval (miller)

testimony.quarrel_subject: at carnaval 1613, children found his caines in cloaque trying to kill them; he struck Petroniere's son and ducked him in stream
testimony.threat_quote: child had several times said qu'il s'en repentiroit

testimony.quarrel_subject: brother Nicolas Masson (sergent) had ordered Petroniere to remove her flax from fountain behind chateau

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: previous Tuesday became letargique et tout stupide

testimony.quarrel_subject: ordered her to remove flax from fountain
employed Jean Varnier to recondition two barrels, but not properly cleaned so wine was spoiled

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: on next trip to fetch wine

witnesses.name: Antoinette de Ranfaing veuve de Nicolas Vanderchamps

testimony.quarrel_subject: quarrel with husband, Petroniere spent night crying in barn
7 years earlier Petroniere had not returned a force she had borrowed to shear sheep, and witness had taken a water-bucket instead

harms_alleged.target: child partly paralysed on right side

testimony.quarrel_subject: he acted for neighbours to prevent her moving into a house
quarrel with accused

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 6 years earlier; found fire around cot and baby burned

timeline.subject: Nicolas Varnier (tabellion)
timeline.details: warned Jean Varnier and Petroniere that Nicolas Vallat had sworn to have her burned if she didn't cure his wife within 15 days

timeline.subject: Nicolas Vallat
timeline.details: Jean Varnier reproached him; Vallat attacked Petroniere with sword, gave her several blows on back calling her witch

timeline.subject: Jean Varnier
timeline.details: Jean Varnier dit Bessat made submission to prévôt asking for investigation into conduct of his wife to vindicate her honor

timeline.subject: Prévôt
timeline.details: Prévôt records acceptance and notes several people have informed him of her ill fame and suspicion

timeline.subject: Petroniere
timeline.details: 42 witness testimonies collected

timeline.subject: Petroniere
timeline.details: first interrogation; denied all charges of witchcraft

timeline.subject: Petroniere
timeline.details: confrontations with witnesses; generally denied all serious allegations

timeline.subject: PG des Vosges
timeline.details: asks for torture ordinaire

timeline.subject: Change de Nancy
timeline.details: approves torture

timeline.subject: Petroniere
timeline.details: first torture session; thumbscrews on hands and feet, then racked; confessed to being witch but gave incoherent statements

timeline.subject: Petroniere
timeline.details: retracted confession; said she is not a witch

timeline.subject: PG des Vosges
timeline.details: asks for second torture

timeline.subject: Change de Nancy
timeline.details: approves second torture

timeline.subject: Petroniere
timeline.details: second torture session; thumbscrews and lengthy racking; confessed to seduction and sabbat about a year earlier but denied all maleficia

timeline.subject: Petroniere
timeline.details: slow to confirm limited confessions; refused to name accomplices after warned against false accusations

timeline.subject: Petroniere
timeline.details: asked judges to hear her again; said she was no witch but willing for matters to go forward

timeline.subject: PG des Vosges
timeline.details: asks for third torture due to unsatisfactory confessions and denial

timeline.subject: Change de Nancy
timeline.details: approves third torture

timeline.subject: Petroniere
timeline.details: third torture session; renewed admission she was witch, promised not to retract again

timeline.subject: PG des Vosges
timeline.details: notes last statement sounds like retraction; asks for banishment for life and confiscation of goods

timeline.subject: Change de Nancy
timeline.details: agrees to banishment but without confiscation

timeline.subject: Petroniere
timeline.details: Prévôt states bons hommes jugeants sentenced her to be burned alive; executed after he persuaded them to commute sentence to strangling first

torture.restrictions: torture ordinaire initially approved; multiple sessions required due to retractions

prior_accusations.context: executed witch who blamed Petroniere for illnesses; told multiple witnesses she was responsible for their ailments
executed witch who cured witness 12's child and said a woman living under same roof had made child sick

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Vallat
notable_quotes.french: ne guerissoit sa femme qu'elle avoit ensorcellé qu'il la feroit brusler et ce dans quinze jours
notable_quotes.english: if she didn't cure his wife whom she had bewitched, he would have her burned within fifteen days
notable_quotes.context: threat made before sword attack on Petroniere

notable_quotes.speaker: Petroniere
notable_quotes.french: elle desireroit qu'on la preigne afin de pouvoir faire conoistre de son innocence
notable_quotes.english: she wished they would seize her so she could prove her innocence
notable_quotes.context: reportedly said while crying in company of other women, according to witness 1

notable_quotes.speaker: Marguerite femme Nicolas Besdel (witness 10)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il prenoit grande peine, mais qu'avant qu'il fust peu de temps le diable en emporteroit des pieces
notable_quotes.english: he was taking great pains, but before long the devil would carry off pieces of him
notable_quotes.context: threat Petroniere allegedly made to Nicolas Besdel after he struck her child

notable_quotes.speaker: Marie Grand Didier (witness 16)
notable_quotes.french: qu'aultant valloit qu'il fust mort et qu'il estoit mort
notable_quotes.english: it would be as well if it were dead and it was dead
notable_quotes.context: Petroniere murmured this while holding the baby the day before it was found dead in cradle

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Varnier (husband)
notable_quotes.french: elle avoit une mechante teste, et luy estoit si rude et rigoreuse qu'il estoit en deliberation de la quiter, et se retirer en Allemaigne
notable_quotes.english: she had a wicked head, and was so harsh and severe to him that he was considering leaving her and retiring to Germany
notable_quotes.context: complaints made in fields last harvest, according to witness 21

notable_quotes.speaker: Petroniere
notable_quotes.french: O quelle justice, justice de dieu
notable_quotes.english: O what justice, justice of God
notable_quotes.context: said repeatedly during first torture session

notable_quotes.speaker: Petroniere
notable_quotes.french: nous aions a faire escrire ce que nous voudrions, et que si elle n'est saulve veu ce qu'elle endure, il ny aura personne qui le soit
notable_quotes.english: we can write what we want, and if she is not saved given what she endures, no one will be

notable_quotes.speaker: Petroniere
notable_quotes.french: quand elle diroit la verité on ne la croiroit pas, qu'elle n'est pas telle qu'on l'estime, scavoir sorciere
notable_quotes.english: when she would tell the truth no one would believe her, that she is not what they think, namely a witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Petroniere
notable_quotes.french: qu'on fit d'elle ce que l'on voudroit, et que si on la vestoit de ladite chemise et rasoit, il faudroit tout endurer
notable_quotes.english: they could do what they wanted with her, and if they dressed her in the shirt and shaved her, she would have to endure it all
notable_quotes.context: resigned statement about being prepared as witch for execution

notable_quotes.speaker: Demenge Biol (witness 31)
notable_quotes.french: possible elle n'estoit autre chose qu'un fantosme, posé avec eux par l'ennemy, en lieu de la realité de son corps, qui pouvoit estre a tel temps ailleurs par luy transporté
notable_quotes.english: possibly she was nothing but a phantom, placed with them by the enemy, instead of the reality of her body, which could be at that time elsewhere transported by him
notable_quotes.context: speculation during harvest storm incident when Petroniere seemed in a trance

notable_quotes.speaker: Curien Daguet (witness 18)
notable_quotes.french: personne ne vouloit prendre le mauvais gré contre elle, pour ce que chacune la craignoit, mais qu'il la prendroit
notable_quotes.english: no one wanted to take offense against her, because everyone feared her, but he would
notable_quotes.context: quarrel over payment for keeping her animals

notable_quotes.speaker: Petroniere
notable_quotes.french: si elle scavoit ou il y avoit un devin elle l'iroit plustost trouver sur son dos qu'elle ne deut apprendre la verité de ce dequoy on la chargeoit
notable_quotes.english: if she knew where there was a diviner she would go find him on her back rather than not learn the truth of what she was charged with
notable_quotes.context: statement to witness 36 about wanting to know truth of accusations

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicole femme Nicolas Gerardin (witness 27)
notable_quotes.french: si elle estoit sorciere comme il se publioit, il failloit qu'elle endurast le feu, et qu'elle respondoit qu'elle estoit aussy nette de ce crime que luy et autres qui l'en chargeroient
notable_quotes.english: if she was a witch as was being said, she would have to endure fire, and she replied that she was as innocent of this crime as him and others who charged her with it
notable_quotes.context: argument between Petroniere and her husband overheard by witness

relationships.evidence_text: Petroniere femme Jean Varnier dit Bessat; married for 18 years
daughter of Nicolas Coua of Olichamps near Remiremont
daughter of Nicolas Coua and his wife Jannon
Zabillon daughter of Nicolas le Moine, merchant of Bruyeres
18 months earlier had married Zabillon daughter of Nicolas le Moine
Marie Grand Didier femme a Nicolas Valot tabellion
Bastlenne veuve Demenge Valot; husband died after strange malady
when her son Nicolas had married his first wife Georgine Gustin
Nicolas Besdel and Marguerite femme Nicolas Besdel
Antoinette de Ranfaing veuve de Nicolas Vanderchamps

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes over payment, rental arrangements, and services. Husband Jean Varnier was cooper/tonnellier. Petroniere worked as day laborer and servant. Witnesses mention disputes over: payment for cattle herding (witness 18), hay harvest payment (witness 8), house rental (witnesses 22, 27), barrel reconditioning payment (witness 38), borrowed tools (witness 40), aide generale tax (witness 30), terrasse/garden produce (witness 24). Husband complained she prevented him from buying wine and necessities despite his infirmity. Poverty appears to be factor.

harms_catalog.victim_name: son of Marie femme Mongeon Francois
harms_catalog.harm_description: leg trouble which afflicted him for a long time, still had pains in side after partial cure
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: son aged 14-15 chosen as cattle herdsman assistant instead of one of Petroniere's sons
harms_catalog.method_alleged: witchcraft; another woman secretly obtained bread, salt, and ashes from Petroniere's house for cure

harms_catalog.victim_name: Zabillon daughter of Nicolas le Moine
harms_catalog.harm_description: died believing herself bewitched
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: dispute with her and her father over some cloth damaged by a child

harms_catalog.harm_description: stomach trouble and swellings in loins which had lasted a year, eased after she visited him
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: asked him to take one of her sons as assistant, angry when he chose another boy

harms_catalog.harm_description: animal like a pig, noir et rougeatre, ran among troop knocking over 50, killing 2
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: same as above - refusal to hire her son
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: around St. Jean previous year during thunderstorm
harms_catalog.method_alleged: demonic animal sent during storm

harms_catalog.harm_description: became eticq at Easter then died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: lived in same house, no known cause

harms_catalog.harm_description: une maladie extraordinaire which lasted 5 months
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Jeandon (executed witch) identified Petroniere as responsible; wife recovered next day after Jeandon threatened Petroniere

harms_catalog.harm_description: died comme enragé
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: warned husband about damaging young tree when crossing her land with cart
harms_catalog.method_alleged: she touched horse

harms_catalog.victim_name: horses and other animals of Mongeon Feburel
harms_catalog.harm_description: lost various animals, notably horses
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: animals had eaten some of her oats and she had been angry
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Jeandon advised to buy horses cheaply, said a woman caused misfortune but had no power over their persons

harms_catalog.harm_description: ill for 18 weeks after giving birth
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: mother-in-law cancelled hay harvest contract with Jean Varnier, gave him 3 gros; he and wife were furious
harms_catalog.method_alleged: from Petroniere's ill-will after witness feared her while pregnant

harms_catalog.harm_description: died suddenly
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: witness stepped on her goose with horse and broke its leg; she demanded payment; later father agreed to cart manure for her husband
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: night before he was to cart manure

harms_catalog.harm_description: lost 7 beasts
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: children fighting, Nicolas struck Petroniere's child
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Petroniere's threat that devil would carry off pieces of him

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrel with Petroniere
harms_catalog.method_alleged: cured overnight with bread, salt, and ashes from Petroniere's house

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill in a strange manner
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: same family
harms_catalog.method_alleged: remedy (bread, salt, ashes) had no effect on second child

harms_catalog.harm_description: ill
harms_catalog.method_alleged: witness tried to obtain bread, salt, ashes but was discovered by Petroniere

harms_catalog.harm_description: persistent illness, periodically out of her wits
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: dispute about a house
harms_catalog.method_alleged: ceased to be ill after Petroniere told her she would recover (after hearing she was to be accused)

harms_catalog.harm_description: became tout perclus et comme eticq, witness lost her milk
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: various quarrels while living in same house
harms_catalog.method_alleged: cured by Claudate Clauchepied (since executed) who put child in apron, murmured words; said woman under same roof caused it

harms_catalog.victim_name: baby of Claudate femme Demenge Piat
harms_catalog.harm_description: became strangely unwell and remained so until taken to Monsieur Saint Hubert at Aultrey
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: dispute as result of pig which escaped and did damage
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: same night just before St. Jean

harms_catalog.harm_description: left arm perclu and other also affected, seemed that les chiens luy devorent les intestines
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: dispute with Petroniere's daughter Francoise who kept touching her; great quarrels when they lived together

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill of strange malady from which he died after languishing more than a year
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Petroniere served at fiancailles but behaved insolently from drinking; not employed at marriage feast; did not come
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Jeandon confirmed suspicions when Demenge Valot named her

harms_catalog.harm_description: fire in the house during feast
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: same as above

harms_catalog.harm_description: man killed in stable where horses of guests were kept
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: same as above

harms_catalog.harm_description: illness for 2 years with loss of sight
languished for 18 months
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: refused to take Petroniere's daughter as servant

harms_catalog.harm_description: found dead in cot
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after she had been to see it
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Petroniere picked baby up, felt its body, murmured qu'aultant valloit qu'il fust mort et qu'il estoit mort; found dead shortly after midnight

harms_catalog.victim_name: second child of Marie Grand Didier
harms_catalog.harm_description: died

harms_catalog.victim_name: horse and cow of Claudon Jean Remy
harms_catalog.harm_description: horse recovered, cow did not
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: dispute when cooking bread, he told her not to be late au preiudice d'autruy; she became very angry
harms_catalog.method_alleged: had Petroniere brought to see them; she told him horse would recover but not cow, and it turned out so

harms_catalog.harm_description: lost ox
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: he and brother refused to let house to Jean Varnier, crainte du mauvais gré des voisins
harms_catalog.method_alleged: brother sold other 7 animals at St. Dié for fear of worse

harms_catalog.harm_description: sickness which still troubled him with pains in arms and legs
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: various quarrels when living in same house 14 years before; he struck her with buche
harms_catalog.method_alleged: after he struck her, she made her back bloody with meat from butcher and complained of him

harms_catalog.harm_description: died
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Jeandon told witness her child died through Petroniere's witchcraft

harms_catalog.harm_description: tout perclu, sans apparence que ce fust de maladie naturelle, ains de pure sortilege
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: husband caught her taking terrasse from their garden and reprimanded her
harms_catalog.method_alleged: cured instantly and almost totally with bread, salt, and ashes from Petroniere's house

harms_catalog.harm_description: afflige de tranchées au petit ventre
harms_catalog.method_alleged: remedy (bread, salt, ashes) did not cure him; on way back from Docelles met Petroniere's 13-14 year old son who took him by arm and swung him round 2-3 times; became ill same evening

harms_catalog.victim_name: child of Nicole femme Nicolas Gerardin
harms_catalog.harm_description: became malade et eticq and died

harms_catalog.method_alleged: subsequently recovered after Petroniere visited and said mal cesseroit moiennant Dieu

harms_catalog.harm_description: serious eye illness
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrelled with her husband over aide generale

harms_catalog.harm_description: died comme enragée

harms_catalog.harm_description: ill

harms_catalog.method_alleged: cat jumped on cot but could not be found afterwards in locked room

harms_catalog.method_alleged: cat on cot

harms_catalog.harm_description: lost ox

harms_catalog.method_alleged: child had several times said qu'il s'en repentiroit

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell strangely

used for transporting hay, manure; horse pulling cart
sold by Antoine Gaspar's wife; Jeandon knew about it supernaturally

witness returning from there when met Petroniere's son

where husband would escape and spend money against Petroniere's wishes

storm incident during harvest when Petroniere seemed in trance and asked about Anezon mountain
sudden storm evening after Petroniere predicted it to Nicolas Crance

multiple disputes over payment and debt
husband complained of her harsh treatment regarding money
many witnesses mention poverty and fear

prior_legal_disputes.description: Nicolas Besdel mentioned 'quelque proces' they had with Petroniere
George Hatton struck Petroniere with buche; she made her back bloody and complained of him
Nicolas Vallat attacked Petroniere with sword, gave her several blows on back
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: this led to her husband requesting investigation

hearsay_chains.content: Jeandon told him Petroniere was responsible for his wife's illness
Jeandon advised them about horses and said a woman caused misfortune
Clauchepied said woman under same roof made child sick
Jeandon confirmed Demenge Valot's suspicions of Petroniere
Petroniere had been seen before dawn under a waggon with Jeandon
reported his suspicions and conversation with Jeandon
Jeandon told her child Didier died through Petroniere's witchcraft
suggested Petroniere might be responsible for son's illness
asked witness to get bread, salt, and ashes

emotional_state_notes: reportedly cried and said she wished to be seized to prove innocence (witness 1)
cried and was discomforted excessively knowing suspicions (witness 2)
disturbed knowing proceedings likely, talked of shaving herself (witness 4)
spent night crying in barn after quarrel with husband (witness 39)
visited sick people, brought food, cried when she saw them crying (witness 28)
said repeatedly 'O quelle justice, justice de dieu' during torture
resigned to fate, asked for trial to conclude quickly

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: accused Demenge Biol of often beating his wife

extraction_metadata.notes: Exceptionally well-documented trial with 42 witnesses providing detailed testimony. Multiple torture sessions with retractions and renewals of confession. Final outcome: Change de Nancy recommended banishment without confiscation, but local bons hommes jugeants sentenced to death by burning; Prévôt persuaded them to allow strangling first. Trial shows classic pattern of accumulated reputation, economic conflicts, and pressure from executed witches' accusations. Petroniere maintained some level of denial throughout despite torture, never provided detailed sabbat descriptions or named accomplices despite repeated questioning. Jeandon (previously executed witch) appears as key third party who identified her to multiple witnesses. Counter-magic with bread, salt, and ashes from her house features prominently in multiple testimonies.
